title_it:
Babilonia.

(Note: "Babylon" could also be translated as "Babilonia" in Italian, but further context about the poem would be helpful in providing a more accurate translation.)
poem_en: Dune Eden, to propagate promptitude, interlude—saga of life. Grass from rains, tears from strife, complex conditions ever rife.
poem_it: Duna dell'Eden, per propagare prontezza, interludio—saga della vita. Erba dalla pioggia, lacrime dalla lotta, condizioni complesse sempre in agguato.
